sentences.en: Brian's toe is still badly swollen and he cannot put on his shoe.
sentences.cn: 布赖恩的脚趾还是肿得很厉害，穿不上鞋。

sentences.en: By standing on tip - toe, I managed to reach the button.
sentences.cn: 我踮起脚才勉强够着电钮.

sentences.en: he carries out random spot checks to keep everyone on their toes.
sentences.cn: 他进行现场突击检查以使每个人都保持警觉。

sentences.en: He got coated with slime from head to toe.
sentences.cn: 他弄得从头到脚都是泥.

sentences.en: He stubbed his toe (= hurt it by kicking it against something ) on a rock.
sentences.cn: 他的脚趾踢到一块石头上受了伤。

sentences.en: He was dressed in white from head to toe.
sentences.cn: 他从头到脚穿了一身白色。

sentences.en: I stubbed my toe against a stone.
sentences.cn: 我的脚趾戳在一块石头上.

sentences.en: My horse has hurt his toe so I can't race him.
sentences.cn: 我的马伤了脚趾,我不能骑它比赛.

sentences.en: My right toe struck against a submerged rock.
sentences.cn: 我的右脚趾踢到水中的一块石头上了。

sentences.en: Ouch! You trod on my toe!
sentences.cn: 哎哟！你踩着我的脚指头了！

sentences.en: Redman broke a toe in training.
sentences.cn: 雷德曼在训练中折断了一根脚趾。

sentences.en: She took care to paint her toe nails a lurid red or orange.
sentences.cn: 她精心地把脚指甲涂成妖艳的红色或橙色。

sentences.en: The shoe pressed painfully against her big toe.
sentences.cn: 鞋子把她的大脚趾挤得很痛.

sentences.en: They showed the most toe-curling home videos.
sentences.cn: 他们播放了最令人尴尬的家庭录像。

sentences.en: They were sensibly dressed from top to toe in rain gear.
sentences.cn: 他们从头到脚都用雨具捂得严严实实，非常明智。

sentences.en: You'll have to toe the mark if you work here.
sentences.cn: 如果你在这里工作,就必须服从命令.

words.tran_cn: 斜钉；装尖；用脚尖踢（toe的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 踵趾动作；踵和趾；脚跟与脚尖双脚旋转
(非正式)使某人欣喜不已；使某人深觉恶心

phrases.phrase: step on (someone's) toes 或 tread on (someone's) toes
phrases.tran_cn: 触犯某人，得罪某人：伤害、触犯或侵害…的感情、行动或职权

phrases.phrase: toe the line 或 toe the mark
phrases.tran_cn: &I{【体育运动】} &I{【游戏】} 足尖或手抵在起跑线上：比赛或竞赛开始前用脚尖或手触一个记号或一根线作准备
（尤指为打斗、争论而）面对面地

trans.tran_cn: 脚趾，脚尖，（鞋，袜的）足尖部，[体]高尔夫球棒的尖端，轴踵
trans.tran_en: one of the five movable parts at the end of your foot
